Title:
Fomitiporia castilloi sp. nov., and multiples clades around
F. apiahyna and F. texana in Meso- and South America evidenced by
multiloci phylogenetic inferences.
Keywords:
Phellinus sensu lato, Hymenochaetaceae, polypores,
Neotropics, Biogeography, phylogeny.
Abstract:
Fomitiporia castilloi sp. nov. from the lowland rainforest
in French Guyana is described and illustrated. It is characterized
mainly by pileate basidiomata, a plicate margin, abundant, variable
hymenial setae, and basidiospores averaging ≅ 6 × 5 µm. In a
phylogenetic inferences based on a DNA sequence data set of 4 loci (5’
end of the LSU, ITS-5.8S, partial Tef-1 and rpb2), this species has an
isolated position, basal to a clade composed otherwise, and so far
exclusively, of species with resupinate basidiomata and occurring in the
Neotropical areas. The multiloci phylogenetic inferences evidenced also
an unreported complexity within the Neotropical area, with multiple
clades in the vicinity of F. apiahyna or F. texana, representing
potential species.
